description: Company Description  Work with Us. Change the World.  At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Job Description  AECOM is actively seeking a bright and highly motivated Entry Level Environmental Engineer for employment in our Water Business Line based out of our New York, NY office.  This is position will assist and support Wastewater/Water Design and Program Management Projects. The Position will work with Project Managers on all project phases including Facility Planning, Design, Procurement, Construction and Close Out. Work will include helping with the management and coordination of design projects on Wastewater/Water treatment facilities. Field work will be required and field visits to project sites within the NYC Metro area will be required to provide support as design liaison on ongoing construction projects.  This position is expected to begin in June 2024.  The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  Prepares designs, calculations, sketches, diagrams, schematic drawings, and final working drawings under the supervision of an experienced engineer.  Collects and analyzes data under the supervision of an experienced engineer.  Uses computer software as a tool for solving basic engineering problems.  Performs work in accordance with agreed upon budget and schedule under supervision.  Performs specific and limited portions of a broader assignment of an experienced engineer.  Gathers and correlates basic engineering data using established and well-defined procedures.  Works on detailed or routine engineering assignments involving calculations and relatively simple tasks.  Identifies discrepancies in results and proposes approach to solve new problems encountered.  Builds analytic and design skills.  Conducts engineering design under the supervision of an  experienced engineer.  Creates designs, calculations, sketches, diagrams, schematic drawings, and final working drawings under the supervision of an experienced engineer.  Collects and analyzes data under the supervision of an experienced engineer.  Uses computer software as a tool for solving basic engineering problems.  Performs work in accordance with agreed upon budget and schedule under supervision.  Qualifications  Minimum Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Environmental or Bioenvironmental/Bioresource Engineering with an emphasis in water, wastewater, water resources, or related field required.  Preferred Qualifications  Engineer-in-Training (EIT) or Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) preferred.  Basic knowledge of industry standard computer software for the position (examples include software such as AutoCAD and Microsoft Office.  Education geared towards water and wastewater engineering – emphasis on engineering principles to the enhancement and sustainability of the world’s natural resources.  Interest in sustainability, combatting climate change, greenhouse gas emissions reductions and general knowledge of Scope 1/2/3/4 type emissions.  Self-starter and ability to take initiative, proactive.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, able to present ideas.  Strong attention to detail and accuracy of work with excellent organizational skills.  Ability to collaborate and work with a diverse and progressive team.  Ability to meet quality, schedule and budget expectations.  Ability to multi-task and be flexible while meeting deadlines.  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, MS Teams).  Additional Information  Relocation assistance is not available for this position.  Sponsorship is available for this position.  Offered rate of compensation (New York locations only) will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The salary range for this position is $70,000 - $83,000. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D and disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absence, voluntary benefits, perks, wellness and global well-being, and global EAP, Business Travel, and Service Awards programs. Job Description  The Civil Engineering Department of AECOM’s Transportation Business Line is actively seeking Entry-Level Civil Engineers for employment in our Philadelphia, PA office. Under the supervision of a Project Engineer, the appropriately qualified applicant will be part of a Design Team responsible for the design of small to large-scale Highway Improvement Projects such as roadway rehabilitation/safety improvement projects (3R), intersection improvements/optimizations, interstate/limited access highway widening/reconstruction. Design responsibilities include horizontal/vertical geometry, pavement design, 3D modeling, intersections/interchanges design, traffic control/staging, signing and pavement markings design, ADA, Pedestrian and Bicycle design, etc.  AECOM is seeking a Civil Engineer to be based in Philadelphia, PA.  This position is scheduled to begin in Spring/Summer 2024.  The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  Obtaining and reviewing existing information including some field work/site investigations.  Originating technical calculations that advance the design of the project.  Assisting in the development of roadway construction, intersection grading, traffic control, and signing and pavement marking.  Developing 3D models using civil engineering software such as Bentley OpenRoads Designer or Autodesk Civil 3D.  Assisting in the preparation of technical reports and project specifications  Performs work in accordance with agreed-upon budget and schedule under supervision.  Qualifications  Minimum Requirements  Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering or related field  Preferred Qualifications  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  Passed Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) Exam, or ability to take within 6-12 months of employment.  Some experience with AutoCAD, MicroStation, and other civil engineering-related software (Civil 3D, OpenRoads)  Previous work experience or internship with engineering firms, contractors, or DOTs involved in the design, construction, or management of highway or other transportation-related projects. We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.  Job Description  AECOM is eager to find a talented and experienced Operations Manager located in Pompano Beach. This position will be instrumental in guiding and managing a 24/7 hours Traffic Operations Center. Seeking a talented operations manager experienced in client relationships, solutions-oriented and staff development.  Responsibilities:  Monitoring staff to ensure operations are monitoring roadways, including detecting, confirming, updating, and responding to scheduled and unscheduled traffic events and congestion with ITS devices such as closed-circuit TV, detectors, etc.  Cultivate the team to act like emergency dispatchers within a call center environment dispatching via a two-way radio system to assist motorists, respond to events and other activities that require timely and efficient responses.  As directed, communicates with client managers, operations/project managers and department lead to provide status updates, ascertain needs within the control room operation and provide solutions to issues.  Supports the development and maintenance of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).  Assist in the research and development of presentations, technical memos, and studies.  Attend internal and external meetings to represent the Transportation Management Center.  Actively reviews maintenance and operational activities for accuracy and appropriateness, providing guidance and feedback to staff as needed.  Mentors current staff and new hires on procedures and policies.  Contribute to accurate and timely after-action reports for incidents and events.  Work on special assignments, tasks, reports and presentations.  Perform other duties as needed by the client and operations manager.  Advise and assist with outreach within the community and client stakeholder networks as well as participating in training activities.  Assists with special event planning and setup.  Effectively supports the recruitment, selection and on-boarding process for project and regional AECOM leadership.  This is a 24/7 emergency operations environment. Shifts can include overnights, weekends, holiday and/or rotating schedules.  Ensures, directly and through subordinates, that projects are completed on time and to company and client standards.  Provides periodic progress reports to senior management.  Has financial and project management responsibilities for the project.  Responsible for the creation of work plans and task definitions, oversees data collection and develops solutions to business/client problems with a focus on financial analysis and improvement.  May provide solutions to business/client challenges developed from a foundation of understanding or analysis of business practices and goals.  May lead/mentor team of consultants and/or other staff.  Works under limited supervision performing complex technical work.  Duties may include technical responsibility for a major phase or component of a project.  Takes lead role in work-flow coordination and project initiatives.  Qualifications  Minimum:  BA/BA and 8 years of related experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and or education  Preferred:  Operations Management experience within a client-based program  Client development experience  Project Management experience  Development of process improvement training experience  Financial program budgeting experience  Staff recruiting and selection experience  Staff recruiting and selection  24/7 Operations experience  Additional Information  Relocation is an option for this position  Visa support is an option for this position  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines  Offered rate of compensation will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The salary range for this position typically is $62,000.00 to $112,900.00.  AECOM is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits program to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D and disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absence, voluntary benefits, perks, wellness and global well-being, and global EAP, Business Travel, and Service Awards programs.  About AECOM  AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.  Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity  You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.  You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. Field document preparation and field data collection, processing, and interpretation.  Supporting office tasks, including data analysis and report preparation.  Utilizes basic scientific principles, theories, practices, and existing technologies to develop solutions for technical problems with limited scope.  Collects and enters data and applies technical principles and theories. Job Description  AECOM is looking to fill multiple full-time Lane Managers to work on a 3-year contract with the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Public Assistance (PA) Program supporting FEMA’s four Consolidated Resource Centers (CRC). This work is 100% remote.  You must be FEMA PA Experienced to qualify for this role.  Project Overview: FEMA’s PA Program provides supplemental funding to state and local governments and eligible private nonprofits, Indian tribal governments, and Alaska Native villages for disaster-related debris removal, emergency protective measures, and restoration of damaged infrastructure. AECOM will support these efforts by providing FEMA a wide range of technical and program management services to support four CRCs processing grant applications and validating/preparing damage description and dimensions, scopes of work, and cost estimates and conducting compliance reviews across multiple disasters.  Position Description : The Lane Manager is a key contributor to the Public Assistance (PA) Program delivery model. They oversee consolidated resources using a standardized approach to PA grant application (project) development in all categories of work. Lane Managers need to have situational awareness of disaster and applicant profiles to forecast resource requirements and prepare for efficient work processing. Lane Managers are responsible for managing their assigned team, managing the quality and production rates of assigned projects, and communicating with multiple stakeholders. The Lane Manager must attend daily stand-up meetings and complete required daily, weekly, and monthly reports.  The Lane Manager must have a working knowledge of the various projects that come into their lane (Completed or Standard), including current work distribution, workflow, and potential special considerations (i.e., Insurance, Mitigation, and Environmental Planning and Historic Preservation (EHP)). In addition, they should be knowledgeable in writing a project’s Damage Description and Dimension (DDD), Scope of Work (SOW), and cost estimate.  The Lane Manager will use FEMA’s Grants Manager system. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.  There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.  We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.  Job Description  AECOM has an exciting leadership opportunity for a Renewable Energy Environmental Program Lead for the West Region of the United States (33 states west of the Mississippi ). This is a senior position within the Company’s Environmental business line, working in partnership with our deep bench of permitting professionals as well as our Energy business line. We are seeking a program leader to oversee our growing book of renewable energy business and drive growth with renewable energy developers, utilities, and other large public and private customers. This position may be based anywhere in the United States (ideally West/Midwest regions).  The candidate will be responsible for: 1) strengthening cohesion of our renewable energy environmental team in the western U.S.; 2) expanding AECOM’s presence in the renewables market through maximizing existing MSA contracts and expanding clients and projects throughout the Western US; and, 3) serve as principal/program manager for large-scale renewable projects. This position will refine and drive the growth strategy for AECOM’s renewables environmental practice (solar, wind, storage, and new energy sources such as hydrogen). Success in this position requires a dynamic, highly motivated individual with existing client relationships across multiple renewable energy developers/providers.  Work will include interaction with senior project managers and task leaders, clients, AECOM’s engineering and design teams, and representatives from cities, counties, and local, regional, state, and federal agencies. Success requires a passion for developing renewable energy solutions, ability to enhance/establish tools and processes for practitioners to efficiently function under multiple MSAs, and the ability to collaborate with an interdisciplinary team of technical, business development (BD) and operations professionals (subconsultants and AECOM staff).  Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  Manage senior-level relationships internally and externally, maintaining a sharp focus on client satisfaction throughout project/program lifecycle.  Provide technical oversight and QA/QC for environmental planning and permitting documents (per NEPA, CEQA, or other similar state agency)  Lead multi-disciplinary teams to respond to project RFPs for renewable energy projects; develop and negotiate scope/fee.  Organize AECOM’s West region renewables team around clients and markets.  Develop and negotiate MSAs.  Develop and implement multi-year renewable energy growth strategy. Refinement of strategic planning and BD tools and processes is expected over time.  Recruit and build a team of delivery/management professionals to support renewable energy growth.  About AECOM’s Environment Business Line  Join AECOM to be part of an expert global team who is connected through a well-developed, worldwide, internal technical practice network through which you can learn from and brainstorm with the best in the world. AECOM is an industry-leading, world class environmental firm, and we want you to succeed within it. We respect and encourage your own pathway to excellence via our Freedom to Grow initiative.  AECOM is known for our award-winning technical excellence, leading-edge science and innovative project delivery. We provide sustainable solutions for some of the world’s most challenging issues. Our global clients and their projects are diverse and interesting. They span market sectors and geographies and require innovative technical solutions to solve wide-ranging environmental problems within diverse community profiles.  AECOM’s Sustainable Legacies program describes our approach to the environment, social equity and governance (ESG.) We embed sustainability throughout our business and help clients embed sustainable practices into their work. We help clients reduce their impact on the environment, achieve compliance and reduce risks.  Qualifications  Minimum Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in environmental planning/policy, Environmental Science, or related field  Minimum 8 years of years of experience in successfully coordinating and managing environmental document preparation and technical studies for renewable projects or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education.  Valid U.S Driver's license is required.  Preferred Qualifications:  Master’s degree in environmental planning/policy, Environmental Science, or related field  15+ years of experience in successfully coordinating and managing technical studies (siting, due diligence, permitting, and construction compliance) document preparation for renewable projects.  Understanding of regulatory permitting landscape, including permitting through the Bureau of Land Management, US Army Corps of Engineers, Regional Water Quality Control Boards, US Fish and Wildlife Service, State Historic Preservation Office, and state-specific Departments of Fish and Wildlife.  Proven track record of successful marketing of winning work and building client relationships in renewable sector.  Understanding of regulatory permitting environment for renewables projects  Experience in providing strategic advice to clients on CEQA and NEPA review process and permitting requirements.  Demonstrated experience in addressing other state and federal environmental regulations, consultation requirements, and Executive Orders.  Exceptional detail orientation and attention to quality.  Ability to work independently and demonstrate a high level of competence and experience in working with teams, clients, subcontractors, and regulatory personnel.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills to effectively manage programs and interact with teams of staff, subconsultants, and clients.  Experience in marketing and business development efforts in pursuit of new projects.  Additional Information  Due to the nature of the work, US Citizenship is required.  Offered rate of compensation (Colorado locations only) will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The salary range for this position is $100,000.00 - $171,000.00.  AECOM is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits program to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D and disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absence, voluntary benefits, perks, wellness and global well-being, and global EAP, Business Travel and Service Awards programs. Field document preparation and field data collection, processing, and interpretation.  Supporting office tasks, including data analysis and report preparation.  Utilizes basic scientific principles, theories, practices, and existing technologies to develop solutions for technical problems with limited scope.  Collects and enters data and applies technical principles and theories. Job Description  AECOM is looking to fill multiple full-time Lane Managers to work on a 3-year contract with the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Public Assistance (PA) Program supporting FEMA’s four Consolidated Resource Centers (CRC). This work is 100% remote.  You must be FEMA PA Experienced to qualify for this role.  Project Overview: FEMA’s PA Program provides supplemental funding to state and local governments and eligible private nonprofits, Indian tribal governments, and Alaska Native villages for disaster-related debris removal, emergency protective measures, and restoration of damaged infrastructure. AECOM will support these efforts by providing FEMA a wide range of technical and program management services to support four CRCs processing grant applications and validating/preparing damage description and dimensions, scopes of work, and cost estimates and conducting compliance reviews across multiple disasters.  Position Description : The Lane Manager is a key contributor to the Public Assistance (PA) Program delivery model. They oversee consolidated resources using a standardized approach to PA grant application (project) development in all categories of work. Lane Managers need to have situational awareness of disaster and applicant profiles to forecast resource requirements and prepare for efficient work processing. Lane Managers are responsible for managing their assigned team, managing the quality and production rates of assigned projects, and communicating with multiple stakeholders. The Lane Manager must attend daily stand-up meetings and complete required daily, weekly, and monthly reports.  The Lane Manager must have a working knowledge of the various projects that come into their lane (Completed or Standard), including current work distribution, workflow, and potential special considerations (i.e., Insurance, Mitigation, and Environmental Planning and Historic Preservation (EHP)). In addition, they should be knowledgeable in writing a project’s Damage Description and Dimension (DDD), Scope of Work (SOW), and cost estimate.  The Lane Manager will use FEMA’s Grants Manager system.
